segment.source: Terminology
segment.target: Terminology

segment.source: The following terminology is commonly used in cryptography and public key infrastructure (PKI).
segment.target: The following terminology is commonly used in cryptography and public key infrastructure (PKI).

segment.source: Term
segment.target: Term

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Encryption
segment.target: Encryption

segment.source: The process of transforming data by using a cryptographic algorithm and key.
segment.target: The process of transforming data by using a cryptographic algorithm and key.

segment.source: The transformed data can be recovered only by using the same algorithm and the same (symmetric) or related (public) key.
segment.target: The transformed data can be recovered only by using the same algorithm and the same (symmetric) or related (public) key.

segment.source: Decryption
segment.target: Decryption

segment.source: The process of returning encrypted data to its original form.
segment.target: The process of returning encrypted data to its original form.

segment.source: Plaintext
segment.target: Plaintext

segment.source: Originally referred to an unencrypted text message.
segment.target: Originally referred to an unencrypted text message.

segment.source: Currently refers to any unencrypted data.
segment.target: Currently refers to any unencrypted data.

segment.source: Ciphertext
segment.target: Ciphertext

segment.source: Originally referred to an encrypted, and therefore unreadable, text message.
segment.target: Originally referred to an encrypted, and therefore unreadable, text message.

segment.source: Currently refers to any encrypted data.
segment.target: Currently refers to any encrypted data.

segment.source: Hashing
segment.target: Hashing

segment.source: The process of converting variable length data into a fixed length, typically smaller, value.
segment.target: The process of converting variable length data into a fixed length, typically smaller, value.

segment.source: By comparing hashes, you can obtain reasonable assurance that two or more data are the same.
segment.target: By comparing hashes, you can obtain reasonable assurance that two or more data are the same.

segment.source: Signature
segment.target: Signature

segment.source: Encrypted hash of digital data typically used to authenticate the sender of the data or verify that the data was not tampered with during transmission.
segment.target: Encrypted hash of digital data typically used to authenticate the sender of the data or verify that the data was not tampered with during transmission.

segment.source: Algorithm
segment.target: Algorithm

segment.source: A step-by-step procedure for encrypting data.
segment.target: A step-by-step procedure for encrypting data.

segment.source: Key
segment.target: Key

segment.source: A random or pseudorandom number used as input to a cryptographic algorithm to encrypt and decrypt data.
segment.target: A random or pseudorandom number used as input to a cryptographic algorithm to encrypt and decrypt data.

segment.source: Symmetric Key Cryptography
segment.target: Symmetric Key Cryptography

segment.source: Cryptography in which encryption and decryption use the same key.
segment.target: Cryptography in which encryption and decryption use the same key.

segment.source: This is also known as secret key cryptography.
segment.target: This is also known as secret key cryptography.

segment.source: Asymmetric Key Cryptography
segment.target: Asymmetric Key Cryptography

segment.source: Cryptography in which encryption and decryption use a different but mathematically related key.
segment.target: Cryptography in which encryption and decryption use a different but mathematically related key.

segment.source: This is also called public key cryptography.
segment.target: This is also called public key cryptography.

segment.source: Encoding
segment.target: Encoding

segment.source: The process of encoding digital messages, including certificates, for transport across a network.
segment.target: The process of encoding digital messages, including certificates, for transport across a network.

segment.source: Algorithm Provider
segment.target: Algorithm Provider

segment.source: A DLL that implements a cryptographic algorithm.
segment.target: A DLL that implements a cryptographic algorithm.

segment.source: Key Storage Provider
segment.target: Key Storage Provider

segment.source: A container for storing key material.
segment.target: A container for storing key material.

segment.source: Currently, keys can be stored in software, smart cards, or the trusted platform module (TPM).
segment.target: Currently, keys can be stored in software, smart cards, or the trusted platform module (TPM).

segment.source: X.509 Certificate
segment.target: X.509 Certificate

segment.source: A digital document, typically issued by a certification authority, to verify the identity of an individual, system, or entity to other interested parties.
segment.target: A digital document, typically issued by a certification authority, to verify the identity of an individual, system, or entity to other interested parties.

segment.source: Certificates
segment.target: Certificates

segment.source: This article discusses the use of certificates in UWP apps.
segment.target: This article discusses the use of certificates in UWP apps.

segment.source: Digital certificates are used in public key cryptography to bind a public key to a person, computer, or organization.
segment.target: Digital certificates are used in public key cryptography to bind a public key to a person, computer, or organization.

segment.source: The bound identities are most often used to authenticate one entity to another.
segment.target: The bound identities are most often used to authenticate one entity to another.

segment.source: For example, certificates are often used to authenticate a web server to a user and a user to a web server.
segment.target: For example, certificates are often used to authenticate a web server to a user and a user to a web server.

segment.source: You can create certificate requests and install or import issued certificates.
segment.target: You can create certificate requests and install or import issued certificates.

segment.source: You can also enroll a certificate in a certificate hierarchy.
segment.target: You can also enroll a certificate in a certificate hierarchy.
